conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volume is readable, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with correct multi-face wall geometry, clean cutaway, and clear interior volume; only minor visibility occlusion from remaining wall heights.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches (kitchen at upper-left, large living/dining zone to the right, stair block on the left, central small bathroom core), but perimeter openings and some door placements do not faithfully match the 2D plan (notably entrance/door locations and window count/placement).

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counter/sink present; stairs and a small bathroom enclosure exist, but dining/living furniture is largely absent and bathroom fixtures are not clearly modeled.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable geometry with consistent materials and good visibility; no text/UI clutter in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows do not fully match the 2D plan in wall location and/or count (entrance and several perimeter windows appear inconsistent).
Living/dining furnishings and bathroom fixtures are missing or overly simplified, reducing room identity confirmation.
Some layout details (especially openings/entry positioning relative to the 2D plan) show noticeable deviations, though main room masses remain consistent.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway with strong extrusion and readable spaces, but with notable mismatches in door/window placement and limited interior furnishing fidelity.
